intro: Alschingera olgae, commonly known as the coastal sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Alschingera olgae is adapted to coastal environments, with features such as salt tolerance and drought resistance. It plays an important role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for native wildlife.
